name: South West Strings Badminton Club
description:
**Welcome to South West Strings Badminton Club**
**If you are looking for a purely FUN CLUB to enjoy good games of badminton with and to meet like-minded individuals, look no further as this club is EXACTLY THAT AND MORE!!. We are truly a social club. I set up this club purely to have fun and enjoy the sport of badminton and other fun social activities. We welcome everyone but there has to be a minimum levels ( Advance Beginner and Above ) that we expect if you are unsure of this please call me 07837 440 947 to discuss this.**
**The games are organized by the organizer/s and are supervised. All session list the fees and all players have agreed to the rules and price of the session when RSVPed a session. There are not many rules here but I do expect everyone to be courteous and respectful to each other and show good sportsmanship. If there are any problems, please refer them to me. If you are joining to prove to everyone how good you are seeking to benefit from the club by taking advantage of its members in any unethical way or have negative intents, this is not the club for you!!**
**\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\***
**Session fee is:**
**2hrs session is Â£10 per person**
**3hrs session is Â£15 per person**
**\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\***Â 
**Our Club Venues Locations and Club Days & Session time & skill level requirements;**Â 
**Elephant & Castle / Balham-Clapham South / Streatham Vale - Norbury / East Dulwich / Southfields**

**All Level Sessions:**
**Wednesday at 8pm to 10pm in Streatham Vale - Norbury -SW16**
**Sunday at 5.30pm-7.30pm Clapham South -SW12**

**Advance Beginners and improver:**Â 
**Sundays at 2.30pm to 5.30pm in Balham / Clapham South -SW12**

**Lower Intermediate and above:**
**Tuesdays: 7.30pm to 9.30pm in East Dulwich, SW22**
**Wednesday at 7pm to 10pm in Balham / Clapham South -SW12**Â 
**Thursdays at 7pm to 9pm in Balham / Clapham South -SW12**
**Sundays: 2.15pm to 5.15pm in Balham / Clapham South, SW12**

**Intermediate and above**
**Mondays at 8pm to 10pm in Elephant & Castle, SE1**
**Wednesday at 8pm to 10pm in Elephant & Castle, SE1**
**Thursdays: 8pm to 10pm in Southfield -SW18**

**\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\***
**For all advance beginners please attend our Sunday advance beginner and Improver session or ALL level session so you can be assessed before attending our other sessions.**
**RSVP Policy: Our cancellation period is the lowest in meetup badminton community we don't expect a player to give 24hrs notice as this is unrealistic so with this in mind we have a 12hrs cancellation period before any session. anyone canceling after this time will be charged at session fee/rate no matter whether your space/spot was taken up by someone else. A No shows will result in a ban from this club. If you miss a session, please repay your organizer.**
**Please note, we are an informal meet-up group, and are NOT covered by insurance. If you wish to have personal insurance in case of any injuries, please arrange this yourself prior to playing. Please make sure you warm up before playing.**
**RSVP Cancellation Policy: If an event is full, members will have the option of adding themselves to the waitlist. When spots open up, members will be automatically RSVPed in the order in which they joined the waitlist. Cancellation policy still applies so please ensure you remove your RSVP if you do not wish to attend a session.**
**1 X Late Cancellation :12hrs before session = Session Cost / fee**
**2 X Late Cancellation =Permanent Ban**
**1 X No Show = Permanent Ban**
**Call me if you have question 07837 440 947**Â 
**\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\***
**We now provide a Stringing service:**Â 
**Please be aware that I will do my utmost to string your racket and will check for racket head damages before any work is done on the racket.**
**South West Strings Badminton Club or I will not be responsible for any damages occurred while/after the stringing work.**
**Please be aware you leave your racket with me at your own risk and work won't proceed until you confirm you accept the risk.**
**Price cost of Stringing:**
**Yonex Aerobite Â£21**
**Yonex BG 85 Â£21**
**Yonex Aerosonic Â£20**
**Yonex BG 66 Ultimax Â£20**
**Yonex BG 80 Power Â£19**
**With own String - Â£13**
\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*
**This is an adult only club. The organizers reserves the right to refuse entry where they see fit.**

name: F.R.I.E.N.D.S
description:
DebateğŸ‘©ğŸ»â€ğŸ“, ChatğŸ™‹ğŸ¼â€â™‚ï¸, Make Friends ğŸ’ğŸ½â€â™€ï¸. All are welcome ğŸŒ

Meet like-minded people for new friendships.

Then come on out and join us for our Free Speed Friending social!

We arrange for you to meet and chat with each other. This gives you an easy and convenient way to meet new people in a way that completely dissolves barriers. This is NOT speed dating and so you will be meeting both ladies and gentlemen in mixed groups. The intent is to create friendships.

One of the greatest benefits is that this tears down the walls of shyness. Many people have deep-seated anxiety when it comes to talking to people they donâ€™t know. But when you push outside your comfort zones, this speedy connection opens up the door to allow you to easily communicate and work together with other members of the group.

Speed friending allows you to identify other people with common interests. The conversations that take place donâ€™t have to be deep, profound or even scripted; simply discussing likes and dislikes may lead to future friendships. Often, people want to make new friends, but they arenâ€™t quite sure how to go about it. With speed friending, you can start pursuing that goal.

How to participate: Free Events
Download the Zoom app for free on a desktop or mobile device.
After you click attend, you'll see the Zoom link to join the event.

What happens in the event:

1ï¸âƒ£ Upon entering the event you will be in our virtual lobby where our event hosts will welcome you. We will explain how the event works.

2ï¸âƒ£Group Activity - Breakout rooms with different topics. You will be placed in a 4-6 person breakout room with a topic. Participants can self-select and join different breakout rooms that have topics the host has created.

3ï¸âƒ£ You can choose to have 1-1 conversations at any time by joining the friend zone breakout rooms.

4ï¸âƒ£ Once the event ends you can go to the attendance list and message your mutual matches.

ğŸ¤” Help during the event.

You can reach your event hosts at any time during the event.
If you click Ask for Help in Zoom, it will notify the meeting host that you need assistance.

Is it safe?
Absolutely - All our events are hosted will be monitored throughout the session. if you have any issues, report them to the hosts.

â¤ï¸ Feel free to support the group â¤ï¸

https://www.paypal.com/donate/?hosted_button_id=2VALHT5MVY7C4
or
https://www.buymeacoffee.com/MeetUp

Important Rules
Bad manners, rude comments, and/or inappropriate and disruptive behavior will lead to immediate removal from the event.

âš ï¸Important Reminder âš ï¸
Please ensure that when you register your attendance you actually attend the event. If you do decide not to attend please click not going.

name: Practice Jazz Jams | London
description:
*If you're getting started with jazz, looking to build up a repertoire of standards and learning to improvise with other musicians in a relaxed environment - try out the 'novice setlist' sessions*

*If you're already comfortable with the above, but are looking to improve the more nuanced aspects of your playing and over more challenging standards - then check out the 'intermediate' sessions*

This group is open to all levels of musicians who would like to learn and explore jazz standards & improvisation with others in a friendly & supportive environment

If you're new to the group and had some questions on how it all works just drop me (Xie) a message!

A contribution is charged to cover payment of the room hire, meetup's monthly organiser fee, and my time in organising the sessions.

name: Central London Badminton Club
description:
Central London Badminton Club


We are a group of players looking for new members to join us for Sunday morning and Thursday evening badminton at Euston/ Kings Cross location. We play doubles badminton.


We usually play at Somers Town Community Sports Centre ( address: 134 Chalton Street, London NW1 1RX between 10am-12 noon (sometimes till 1pm) on Sundays and usually go for a quick lunch afterwards. We like to play early so that we can still enjoy the weekend with friends and family.

We also play during the week on Thursday evening - session (7:30pm - 9:30pm) at the same venue.


We are looking for new players whose standard is intermediate (mid) and above to join us (sorry no beginners and improvers or lower intermediate players). We like to play for fun; we have great games but not looking for those who play too serious - so no Lee Chong Wei's and Lin Dan's!


We want to ensure the quality of play while controlling the standard of the club, this means that players who are not quite up to the standard may be asked politely to leave.


We play with quality feathers; cost for two hours is Â£10, (if we play for three hours the cost will be between Â£12-Â£15 depending on number of players participating).


IMPORTANT BITS

â€¢ You will need to bring your own racket, if you need to borrow please message one of the organisers privately.

â€¢ You will need correct shoes and clothing

â€¢ Please ensure that you stretch and warm up before and after sessions to prevent injury.

â€¢ Your are responsible for your own well-being and we and the sports facility representatives will not be responsible for any injury, stolen or damaged property or any other occurrences during our sessions.


BOOKING SYSTEM & CANCELLATIONS

â€¢ If you want to attend the games, you must RSVP for yourself and any friend that you may wish to bring that is not a member.

â€¢ If you do not RSVP and attend, you will be turned away (as there is a limit to amount of players and we want to avoid overcrowding)

â€¢ If you RSVP and DO NOT attend (e.g. Late cancellations / no shows/ friend cannot attend) then you will be fined for the relevant session, unless you remove (or adjust in terms of friends) your RSVP at least 24hrs before the session start time. This will ensure fair access for everyone. The penalty still applies whether or not the spaces vacated were taken by other members. Penalty will be Â£10.

â€¢ If an event is full, members will have the option of adding themselves to the waitlist. When spots open up, members will be automatically RSVPed in the order in which they joined the waitlist. The cancellation policy still applies so please ensure you remove your RSVP if you do not wish to attend a session thus providing others a chance.

â€¢ People who abuse the system may have their membership revoked and banned from rejoining.

â€¢ Our decisions are final.

name: The BCS British Chinese Society
description:
We are the BCS British Chinese Society. Our meetup group aims to bring together Chinese and Asian professionals with social events, sports and cultural activities to network and make new friends.
æˆ‘å€‘æ˜¯ä¸­è‹±æœƒã€‚æˆ‘å€‘æ—¨åœ¨å°‡å¹´è¼•çš„ä¸­åœ‹å’Œäºæ´²å°ˆæ¥­äººå£«çµåˆåœ¨ä¸€èµ·ï¼Œçµäº¤æ–°æœ‹å‹ï¼Œç¤¾äº¤ï¼Œé«”è‚²å’Œæ–‡åŒ–æ´»å‹•ã€‚

Our meetup events include:
\- Social networking drinks \(Chinese/Asian/UK\)
\- Meals \(Chinese\, Japanese\, Korean\, Taiwanese\, Vietnamese\, Malaysian\, Singaporean\, Thai etc\.\)
\- Outdoor and indoor activities: hiking\, bouldering\, cycling\, etc\.Â Â 
\- Tours: museums\, sightseeing
\- Board games
\- and your suggestions\!

Youtube
[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QSJuPtTKeBs](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QSJuPtTKeBs)

Instagram
https://www.instagram.com/bcsbritishchinesesociety/

Join our Facebook Group
[https://www.facebook.com/groups/britishchinese](https://www.facebook.com/groups/bcslondon/)

Like our Facebook page
[https://www.facebook.com/bcs.messenger/](https://www.facebook.com/bcs.messenger/)

ClubhouseÂ 
[https://www.joinclubhouse.com/club/bcs-british-chinese-soc](https://www.joinclubhouse.com/club/bcs-british-chinese-soc)

BCS Online Magazine - Shared HorizonÂ 
https://sharedhorizon.wordpress.com/about-us/

BCS is not funded by any bodies and staffed by unpaid volunteers who are in full time jobs. We would love members and everyone who loves attending to our events to voluntarily make a donation to the below link
[https://www.justgiving.com/crowdfunding/bcs2](https://www.justgiving.com/crowdfunding/bcs2)
To avoid confusion and for the safety of our members, new members will require an actual photo of themselves and real name (shorten is fine) or their membership will be revoked. Furthermore any malicious or offensive comments in the Meetup page or advertising of other groups (unless agreed with the Organisers' team) will also result in the members removal.

If you receive any private message from members you have never met before from Meetup or from any other social media medium or Whatsup and feel uncomfortable from them.Â Â Please contact one of the BCS Organiser and we will have the offender banned.Â Â 

Finally for events that there is a requirement to pay for entry for our event (as a result of extra costs for the hire and services that needs to pay to suppliers in advance), unless otherwise stated, a request for refund 1 week before the start of the event without any prior notice will NOT be refunded. It is not acceptable for Organisers who are volunteers to pay upfront cost out of their own monies and then expect an Organiser to find a replacement in the last minute to pay for a refund from a confirmee of an event. 

Thank you for your co-operation.

name: Weybridge Social Events
description:
Hello

Thanks for showing your interest in this group.

This meetup group is ideal for single people and couples who would like to socialise and build up friendships. This group would suit anybody over 35 as long as your heart is young and your mind is open for adventure.

Events like beach and barbeque parties, walking, ten pin bowling, weekend trips will be offered and any other suggestions from our members will be considered during the year.

\-\-\-\-\-Fees\-\-\-\-

To cover any costs from e.g. obtaining documents for event planning, paying meetup fee, etc, most of the events will have a fee of Â£3




If you would like to host any event then you are welcome to discuss this with me.

\-\-\-\-General Rules\-\-\-\-

To join us, your meetup profile should have a clear photo showing your face and should be current and not be older than 3 years. Your profile also needs to show your real name. Without those two criterion, your request of membership will not be accepted or even deleted, even you have paid the initial joining fee of Â£2.

We reserve the right to delete your membership if your behaviour is inappropriate like rude, aggressive, confrontational and so on. At our age, we should already know how to treat people appropriately. Furthermore, we also reserve the right to remove a member who does not fit in the group whatever the reason is.
In the case you register for an event and later realise that you cannot join the event, then please change your attending status as there is usually a wait list and it is only fair to others.Â Failure to do this resulting in two 'no shows' will mean that you will be removed from the group.
Â 
\-\-\-\-Legal Disclaimer\-\-\-\-
By signing up for this group or any of the events, you agree that you have read and understand the below.
Additionally, by signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK.Â The Group Organiser, Event Host or any other person is not responsible for your safety.Â Please ensure that you are fit enough to attend walks and bring sufficient water and food with you.Â For participating in other types of events (e.g. swimming, camping, bowling), you take part AT YOUR OWN RISK and are responsible for your own safety and well-being.
If you join us for any events or holiday, please understand that you are also responsible for your own preperation.Â You are responsible for making your own travel arrangements and any necessary travel insurance.
Participants are responsible for assessing their own risk, the safety of themselves and their guests and the suitability of any equipment used.
You have voluntarily elected to participate in the events and FULLY ACCEPT AND ASSUME ALL RISKS AND ALL RESPONSIBILITY FOR ANY INJURY, LOSSES AND DAMAGES TO PERSON OR PROPERTY THAT INCUR AS A RESULT OF YOUR PARTICIPATION.
We are not trained leaders, guides or first aiders and we do not employ qualified guides, leaders or first aiders at any events.Â There may not be rescue or medical facilities or expertise necessary in the immediate area to deal with the Risks to which you may be exposed during our activities.Â 
The Organizerâ€™s role is to coordinate the gathering of people at the appointed meeting place for the group to voluntarily take part in the organized Event. It is the same basis of being a group of friends or voluntaries who are undertaking activities (indoor or outdoor) together who invites others to join any activities on this basis via the Meetup web site.
Remember: YOU ARE ATTENDING ALL EVENTS AT YOUR OWN RISK.!Â 
PHOTOGRAPHY
This group may, from time to time, take photographic, digital or video images of event participants for promotingÂ the group. You hereby agree to allow this group to use those images for that purpose without expectation of privacy or renumeration.
PLEASE DO NOT PARTICIPATE IN ANY ORGANIZED EVENTS UNLESS YOU HAVE READ, UNDERSTOOD AND AGREED ITS ENTIRETY.
Â We are looking forward to meeting you.

name: Havering Friends & Social Group
description:
If you are looking to extend/build your friendship group or just wish to socialise more with others, the Havering Friends and Social Group is for you!

We offer a wide variety of events to those that live in and immediately surrounding the Havering area. Idea age is 40 plus. Suggestions for meets are welcomed and we encourage all members who wish to host to contact one of the organisers.

All organisers and event hosts arrange meets in their own time. We donâ€™t get paid to do it and we are not professional event organisers. we want to help other members as much as possible but we all have to take responsibility for ourselves.

There will be an annual Â£10 membership charge payable upon you RSVPing your second event, this is paid via PayPal and you will be contacted to arrange this. This helps cover the charges made by meet-up.

All we ask from all members is that they are courteous and respectful of others. Keep your RSVP up-to-date - please change it if you can no longer make an event. Hope to see you soon

name: Up In The Cheap Seats - Enjoying London Theatre
description:
Welcome to **up-in-the-cheap-seats**. This group aims to bring together people who share a common aim - to *see theatre at reasonable prices*.
All are welcome at our events - We've met so many lovely people and everyone has been so friendly and enthusiastic.Â Group sizes vary so we can meet up before and get a chance to talk to each other. We have a great group of organisers with varied tastes and interests; which keeps our calendar filled with mainstream and more eclectic events.
With over **2,200 events** in the 10 years we've been going, the variety of shows we've seen is immense.Â We see a mixture of musicals, plays, opera, ballet, music, comedians and films and are always open to new suggestions!Â A calender of our events can be found here:Â [https://www.meetup.com/Up-in-the-cheap-seats/events/calendar](https://www.meetup.com/Up-in-the-cheap-seats/events/calendar)
**There is a one-off joiningÂ fee of Â£2.50**Â to be a member of **up-in-the-cheap-seats**. These funds will be used to cover the meetup fees and cover expenses associated with running the group.Â 

Please note, if you are an inactive member for many months (i.e. if you don't log into the website or don't attend any events), you will be removed from the group as we encourage this group to be as active as possible.
So......how does it work?Â 

**We buy our own tickets.** Your event organiser will add a link on the event invitation so you can buy your ticket at the same price that they enjoyed. Obviously the price is not guaranteed especially if the show is popular or you wait a few days before booking.

**Please update your RSVP to confirm that you are joining us.** The organiser will normally add a comment to the event page saying which seat they have purchased. This isnâ€™t mandatory but helps others decide on their seat selection â€“ it is always nice to be sat near or next to another member of the group! The group does not charge to attend individual events (just the one-off Â£2.50 joining fee). Therefore Meetup states that the event is free. This does not mean that your ticket is free - you will need to purchase this yourself.

The event host will post the meet up details a day or two before the show.

We usually meet outside the theatre or in one of the theatre's bars around 30 minutes before the show.

If there is an interval we will meet up again in the bar at the interval so we can all share our opinion of what we have enjoyed (or not!) so far.

We will also usually meet up afterwards for a brief chat about the show but sometimes (depending on how late it is and the day of the week), we may go on somewhere for a drink and a longer chat.

**If you are unable to make an event, please change your RSVP** so that your host knows not to wait for you.Â Â 

Hope to see you at an event soon,
**Your UITCS Oraganisers**
\*Please note, this group does generate a lot of email, but the good news is these settings are customisable, and can easily be changed by going to 'My Profile',Â then 'Emails' and 'Notifications'.

name: London Black Chicks Network
description:
**CLEAR PICTURE OF YOURSELF NEEDED TO JOIN. Please also respect that this is a space for black and mixed race women.**

**To encourage only serious RSVPs there will now be a Â£3 non-refundable fee per event.**

**NO-SHOW POLICY**
You will be removed from the group and banned immediately if you are a no show. This is defined as not attending an event you RSVPd to or cancelling less than 24 hours before the event (this may vary dependent on the type of event/host). Be respectful of the hosts and update your RSVP in good time.

ğŸŒ¸LBCN is here to create a safe space for black and mixed-race women to come together and mingle through social events, travel and more!

ğŸŒ¸All we ask is that everyone treats each other with respect and brings good vibes. Anything other than that and you will be removed.

Any events youâ€™d personally like to host or suggestions are always welcome because youâ€™re bound to find someone else who will be interested x

name: Richmond Park Velo
description:
Welcome to Richmond Park Velo â€“ the friendliest cycling club in west London!

All our events are posted on this Meetup site but check out our own website which is where you'll need to go to sign up if you decide to join us www.richmondparkvelo.com. Come out for a free introductory ride with us first though!

We meet and start most of our rides in Richmond Park or Kingston west London. If you want to join us, you only have to enjoy cycling, getting fitter and making friends. Oh, and you need a road bike!

This cycling club is for all levels from beginners to advanced. So whether you need help using your gears effectively or want to train competitively and enter sportives with us, RPV is the group for YOU!

The ethos of the club is collaborative and considerate riding â€“ the team is stronger than the individual. Have a look through our Club Ride Rules to see what we aspire to. No one is perfect but we all share the aim to improve!

While some of the members race outside the club environment, we discourage racing on club rides where the stronger riders are expected to help the less strong ones by doing more work at the front rather than riding â€œoff the frontâ€. We regroup after hills and stop for mechanicals and punctures.

Members are given a ranking â€“ Steady/Steady+/Intermediate/Intermediate+/Advanced to ensure that the riders in each group on a club ride are, so far as possible, of the same standard. Click here for more information on our ranking system.

All our ride leaders ascribe to the same values of collaborative and considerate riding and offer constructive criticism and encouragement. Here is what we try to do: Ride Leader Guidelines.

Group rides are offered at various levels to ensure compatibility of membersâ€™ abilities. If you are concerned about what level you should start at, drop an email to the Organiser or come to one of our relaxed "Meet the Members" laps evenings where we chat while we cycle and then retire for a beer in a local pub in Richmond or Kingston.

Hereâ€™s our very distinctive club kit https://richmondparkvelo.com/club-kit/ We love it and hope you will too! We ask all members to wear at least a club jersey on club rides.

So, whatâ€™s in it for you? Loads!

We give beginners tips to on how to ride efficiently and improve their hill-climbing and help intermediate cyclists move up to the next level by developing their group riding skills ie. their ability to ride collaboratively as a team.

We hold regular Skills Sessions where you can learn drafting and communication skills in a safe environment.

We organise cycle rides along many different routes in Surrey, Kent, Berkshire and Oxfordshire.

See what weekly rides and other events we offer here: Calendar

Sunday Club rides are typically 50 miles for Steadies; 50 to 60 miles for Inters and 60 to 70 miles for Inter+ and Advanced. All our club rides involve a break at the half way point for a coffee and a sandwich. Many of the members will stay around for â€œrecovery alesâ€ after the ride in a pub by the river in Kingston.

So, whatever your cycling goals, come, make friends and spin your wheels with Richmond Park Velo!

I hope to meet you soon!

Richard

(Organiser)

name: China Unbound's Language Meetup ä¸­è‹±è¯­äº¤æµ
description:
Welcome to our group! This is a community for Chinese and English learners of all levels to learn from one another in a relaxed social environment. Our goals are to have fun, improve language skills through conversation and build a community for Chinese and English learners.

**Why are we different?**

* Structured time to maximise learning
* Facilitated conversations
* Help on hand

**Who is it for?**

* Anyone learning Chinese who would like to improve and practice with native speakers
* Chinese speakers looking to improve their English skills with native speakers
* Learners of all levels

**Format- Speed-chatting!**

* We will pair you up with a native speaker of your target language.
* We will provide fun, engaging topics to prompt your chat.
* Every 30 minutes we rotate with different people. This ensures we cover a diverse range of vocabulary and you get to speak to as many people as possible, making the best use of your time here!

**FAQs:**
**1\. Are the sessions suitable for Beginners?**
Yes, the way we set up the questions allows you to answer the questions as long or as short as you like, so beginners will at least learn the short answers to questions like: 'what's your favorite food and where can I get it?' 'Chinese food at China Town!' From then, you can slowly build up your repertoire.

**2\. Are the sessions suitable for intermediate/advanced speakers?**
Yes, the way we set up the questions allows you to answer the questions as long or as short as you like, so no matter what level you are at, you will be able to practice it to your level.

**3\. Would I end up speaking English all the time and get nothing out of this?**
No, because it is compulsory for everyone to communicate in Chinese for at least half the session with our 'Speed-chatting' format!

**About the host**
China Unbound hosts this meetup. We are a Chinese language school specialised in teaching adults. Over the past 7 years, we have helped many professionals and businesses learn Chinese with ease and fun. For inquiries and bookings, email: info@china-unbound.co.uk, or visit [https://china-unbound.co.uk](https://china-unbound.co.uk)

\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*

name: Mums In Ctrl
description:
Mums in Ctrl is an empowerment platform for working mums worldwide! We believe that every mother is a human with her own dreams, passions and ambitions. It is possible to build brands while raising children and doing both with pride and excellence. However, it is difficult to achieve this kind of synergy, without support, the right resources and the right information.
Â 
Mums in Ctrl are committed to providing daily inspiration, motivation and advice for mothers who are in business. We give mothers a community and a safe space to make other friends who are working mums, to network and relax in a safe space at our events and on our social media platform.

Tap in...

**Click here to join our group chat...**

[https://chat.whatsapp.com/KVRU2Dh5FUAFtGUlks2ykW](https://chat.whatsapp.com/KVRU2Dh5FUAFtGUlks2ykW "https://chat.whatsapp.com/KVRU2Dh5FUAFtGUlks2ykW")

In this group chat we will stay connected, network & get updated of our upcoming events

**ğŸ¥‚MumsInCtrl Community events on our website:**
[https://www.mumsinctrl.com/events](https://www.mumsinctrl.com/events "https://www.mumsinctrl.com/events")

**ğŸ¥‚Book our workspace for your own shoots, events, meetups and more:** [https://www.mumsinctrl.com/workspace](https://www.mumsinctrl.com/workspace "https://www.mumsinctrl.com/workspace")

**ğŸ¥‚ To have your events and businesses featured in our weekly email campaigns**
[https://bit.ly/3IaPReL](https://bit.ly/3IaPReL "https://bit.ly/3IaPReL")

**ğŸ¥‚Join our mailing list**
[https://www.mumsinctrl.com/mailing-list](https://www.mumsinctrl.com/mailing-list "https://www.mumsinctrl.com/mailing-list")

name: Dorking Meet Up
description:
**A local group for local people of Dorking and immediate villages/towns.**

Our group is for adults of all ages who want to meet new people, make new friends and socialise. There will be all types of events and we are happy to take suggestions.
We are NOT a dating site!

No need to feel nervous about meeting people you don't know- we are super friendly.

When joining we recommend you have the phone app so you don't miss out on reminders and messages.

This group will have no membership fee at the present time but if the size grows Meet UP will increase the admin fees to run it and at that point there maybe a one off Â£5 per year fee per member.
This will be communicated in advance to members and they can decide if they want to stay. At present I am prepared to cover the current monthly cost.

name: SQUAD Advanced Social Volleyball
description:
SQUAD Advanced Volleyball

Sunday afternoons 2-4pm at Bacon's College in Canada Water

Level: Advanced / Upper Intermediate only. (Players need to have strong all-round skills and know the 5-1 rotation system and positions)

Session Structure: 45 mins warm up and drills & 75 mins playing time

Cost: Â£ 10 per session

Maximum Capacity: 14 players.

Book your place ASAP and any question please contact us here or via our Facebook page.

https://www.facebook.com/S.Q.U.A.D.VC/

https://www.instagram.com/squadvolleyball/

name: Golf and other sports Socialising
description:
Hi! We are a friendly active group mainly for people interested in golf, snooker, table tennis, and occasionally a few other sports/activities (e.g. cycling). Golf events are generally held in east Berkshire or north west Surrey, whilst other activities are mostly held in Ascot, Sunningdale or Windlesham.

Women and men of any age are welcome at our events (see also ' more details' below). Having fun doing sports or activities, whilst perhaps making some friends are the main aims of the group. Please ensure you have a photo of yourself when joining so that we can recognise you and welcome you when attending events (note: photos are only visible to members). Hope to see you soon!

More details:

* Golf - organised most weekends (in Sunningdale, Ascot, or at one of several other nearby courses mainly in east Berkshire and north west Surrey) - usually over 18 holes (but at least once a month over nine). Further details lower down on this page.
* Table tennis - at least once a month - for players of varied ability up to low league standard (though not suitable for complete beginners) - held at Charters leisure centre, Sunningdale
* Snooker (or Pool) (at Lavender park, Ascot - during the week or at the weekend). Some experience needed for snooker.
* Other sports/activities: Cycle rides (leisurely and on quiet roads or off-road) are organised occasionally (in Windlesham or Windsor Great park). Trips to watch sports or to play petanque may also be organised.
* Please say on your profile which of our regular and occasional activities you are interested in! *Note: Badminton used to be organised (and coaching may still be available), but there is at least three other meetup groups in the area who regularly do this sport (plus some 'no strings badminton') further details available from Dave or David).*

*â€¢Â Note: If you are interested in bridge locally and online please go to:Â [https://www.meetup.com/Ascot-Sunningdale-Bridge-Meetup/](https://www.meetup.com/Ascot-Sunningdale-Bridge-Meetup/)Â .*

There are a roughly equal number of men and women in the group, and members are of various ages from 20's to over 60.
Temporary local residents or visitors to the area from other parts or the country or from overseas are welcome to join if they regularly come to the area or before a visit.
\*If the group is 'full' there may be a delay in accepting you in to the group (but this will be done as soon as possible).
\*\*If you are interested in organising a certain activity please contact Dave.
\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-
\*\*: Golf details: Events are organised at Courses\* to suit experienced, intermediate and improver players mainly. Cost usually Â£25 to Â£40 (for 18 holes). The area has some attractive and quite challenging golf courses. Novice golfers are recommended to come to golf at Lavender Park, Blackwater Valley or Billingbear Park. Other courses that we go to are largely only suitable for more experienced players. The golf courses we visit often or sometimes are Sunningdale Heath, Billingbear Park, Chobham, Downshire, Lavender Park, Pine Ridge, Sand Martins, Mill Ride, Royal Ascot, Sherfield Oaks, Hennerton, Hoebridge, Theale, Sutton Green, Pyrford Lakes and Blackwater Valley.
\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-
Notes:
\*: For 2022 there is a SMALL annual membership charge for active group members (at least), but there is no charge for your first event with the group (if done in the first two years of membership).
\*\*: To keep the membership list up to date; because we have a maximum number of members, probably have a waiting list, and possibly to save money on meetup fees, a FEW/SOME inactive members only who have not paid the annual membership fee may be messaged to check they are still interested and active on Meetup (and if no response removed) or removed:
a) members who have not looked at our meetup site in their first 12 months of membership since the day they joined; or
b) members who have been a member for less than two years, not looked at our meetup site for a year and who have not done any events; or
c) members who have been a member for at least two years, who have not done any events, and who have not looked at our site for at least six months, or
d) any member who has attended events before, who has not done any events in their last 3 years of membership and not looked at our meetup site for at least 12 months.
*\*\*\*Members removed can re-join on payment of the small membership fee. You can live a long way away, but please consider how busy you are on other activities and how far you live or work from the area and whether you will be able to attend events occasionally, before you re-join (note: we rarely do online events).*

name: Friendly Frolickers 50+ singles Meetup Group
description:
This group is for over 50s singles to meet up, socialise and widen their social circle, in a fun, friendly and safe environment. We are looking for new members to join us, attend and host all kinds of events and holidays.


Travel is my passion and although based in London, our events are not limited geographically. Holidays, travel and adventure are also planned in the UK and abroad.


If you love travel or hope to travel in the future, enjoy socialising, making new friends, outdoor activities, cultural events, restaurants and gatherings or anything and everything that is better shared, then 'Friendly Frolickers' is the Meetup group for you.


Whether you want to just socialise, have short breaks away or travel further afield, you can save money by sharing and make new friends.  Our aim is to plan and offer events at the most reasonable prices by researching and resourcing the best deals.


Friendly Frolickers was initially set up as a WhatsApp group in July 2018 when a group of just 7 people were disillusioned with online dating. The purpose of Friendly Frolickers is for over 50s singles to find new friends in a safe relaxed environment and maybe find a new partner if that's what you are looking for.


There is a Â£12 annual fee payable on 1st April. This will help to cover the monthly Meetup subscriptions that organisers have to pay for the Meetup service and enable this group to flourish. This fee is non refundable.


Members must be over 50, single and live in the UK. They must also post a photo of themselves on their profile in order to be recognised at the events.


Please only RSVP for events if you are able to attend and remove your name to â€˜not goingâ€™ as soon as possible if you are unable to attend. This will allow others on the waitlist to take your place.


If you are on a waitlist please remember to keep checking. You will be moved to the â€˜goingâ€™ list automatically when someone cancels (you will be sent a notification so ensure that you switch them on!).  Please also check your private messages regularly. Itâ€™s not unusual for my messages to go unanswered. Very frustrating!


If you have booked an event with a cost involved, please ensure that you make your payment promptly, otherwise you will lose your place and it will be offered to to next member on the list. Often, these ticket deals need to be paid upfront immediately!


If unable to attend an event at last minute, please contact the Host or Organiser as 3 no-shows will result in removal of your profile from the group.


The Organiser and Event Hosts are not tour/travel professionals and as such, are not responsible for your safety, well-being or successful travel/social enjoyment. Please read DISCLAIMER at the foot of this page and decide whether you agree to the conditions of membership of this group.

Only join us if you do.


â€¼ï¸IMPORTANTâ€¼ï¸By joining you agree to treat other members with respect and tolerance and to refrain from ALL FORMS OF NEGATIVE BEHAVIOUR - intimidation, bullying, stalking, verbal, physical or written abuse and foul language. There is a zero tolerance for these behaviours. Please note that if you do not abide by the rules your profile will be removed and you will be banned from rejoining.


Members must become active within the first 3 months and continue participation at least quarterly. Non-participation in group activities over a 3 month period constitutes the member becoming inactive and their profile may be removed. (Private message me if you have good reason and wish to remain a member).


***************************************


DISCLAIMER

Friendly Frolickers is a club which aims to bring people together to make friends, have fun and find travel buddies through socialising using the Meetup platform.


BY JOINING THIS GROUP YOU AGREE TO THE CONDITIONS BELOW:

Members must satisfy themselves that the event they are attending will be within their physical capabilities and within their personally accepted risk profile before taking part. All members who participate in Friendly Frolickers scheduled events do so at their own risk.

Friendly Frolickers members acknowledge that by joining and attending scheduled events that they have read and understood these conditions.

Organisers and Event Hosts offer no advice nor accept any responsibility for the welfare of its members or guests. It is understood that as adults, all care will be taken to safeguard oneself and be responsible for oneself at all times.


No insurance or assurance for any Friendly Frolickers events is offered and organisers and event hosts shall not be held liable nor have to compensate a member or their guest in any way.

The Organisers, Assistant organisers, Event Hosts or ordinary members cannot be held accountable for any financial loss, injuries, death or otherwise that may occur as a result of an event advertised on the calendar.


Members of this group also need to be aware that the Organisers are not professional travel agents, volunteer their time, have no control over the members in this group and therefore cannot be held responsible for any mishaps or altercations be they verbal, physical or via email, which may occur as a result of utilising this medium to enhance their social life and travel options. These issues will need to be resolved by the parties involved.

When appropriate, the Organiser may approach those who transgress and the Organiser may remove their profiles or ban them from the group.


Members who receive emails via the Friendly Frolickers group site requesting their personal contact details should immediately contact abuse@meetup.com as these requests may be from scamming groups and not Friendly Frolickers members at all. The Organiser would appreciate notification if that occurs.

name: London Rams Volleyball Club
description:
London Rams Volleyball Club is a social club based in East London, hosting sessions for intermediate+ level volleyball players to meet new people and have fun

Players attending will be playing their preferred or secondary position, therefore it is a requirement to know 5-1 rotations for your position.

name: Hit & Run Badminton club
description:
Hi everyone... We are social badminton club... Opening our door for new players that would llke to join us... We play every week THURSDAY 3 HR & SUNDAY 3 HOUR, we have regular members that join in session... We been running this Club for Few years.. playing in Hammersmith & Middlesex League .. So if you would like to try out social and some challenging game you can give us a try sometime..




FYI... I am sad to say... It might not be suitable for beginners or lower level players... Club sessions is always Intermediate to higher intermediate players.. So it might not to fair or suitable..

name: Self-Help Hub For Women
description:
This Self- Help Hub provides women an opportunity to find deep positive and lasting change to how you view yourself in the world . It enables you to take charge of you and be truly happy.

Do you find that you are not living the life you want, but just going through the motions.
There are so many things that you want to do , but you donâ€™t even try. You feel that there is more to the life you are living and you want to change it NOW!!

Come to one of our event or webinars and learn how you can start to make some changes to your life

We will be running events and webinars where you will learn the following :

Well-being - physical and mental health
Self-awareness - recognizing your different types of behaviour, what they mean and why you do them

Self-confidence - ways on developing your self confidence

Development of Direction in Life - where are you going and what do you really want out of life?

Goal Setting - how to set goals on a daily, weekly yearly or even 10 yearly basis that you will follow through and stick to.

Creating positive habits that you no longer have to be motivated to accomplish, but just do them.

Motivation and action taking - doing what you say you are going to do.

Positive Mindset - using your life experiences of and turning them into great messages

Developing better relationships - how can you change you relationships and feel happier in them.

Business and Education - how to have the business you want and be financially free.

The Self Help Hub shares the expertise top professionals in their field and helps you to examine at all aspects of your life you wish to excel in.

From physical and mental well being to job and business direction.
Creating strong and valuable relationships to finding you purpose in life.

It gives you different easy take away strategies that can be done immediately and you can make miraculous changes in your life!

name: Bacon's College Badminton Group - Canada Water
description:
A friendly sociable badminton club for intermediate and above players looking for fun challenging games!

Feather Shuttles provided so just bring a racket & water!!

************************************************

Cost per person: Â£10.00 (payment via bank transfer to host) - NO CASH ACCEPTED ON THE DAY

Courts per session : 4

Time: 7-10pm

Days: Every Thursday/Friday - (however once the venue is fully reopened we will revert back to Fridays only)

Location: Canada Water

Address: Bacon's College, Timber Pond Road, London, SE16 6AT

Nearest Stations: Canada Water (Jubliee Line/Overground Line) or Rotherhithe (Overground Line)

name: Divorce Club London
description:
**If you are going through a divorce, thinking about a divorce, are newly separated, or already divorced, then this group is for you.**

**Divorce can be challenging, but it is also a real opportunity for personal growth and change. Lucy and Isabelle co-founded Divorce Club back in 2016 for one simple reason â€“ we know that no one should go through divorce alone! It's now the largest Divorce Club in the UK.**

You may be feeling lonely, unsupported or simply looking for friendly help & advice in order to move on. Afterall, what other life event can uproot you from your home, shake your financial security, reduce your time with your children and make friends and family disappear overnight? Sometimes you donâ€™t know where to turn, or just feel angry or sad.

Thatâ€™s where we at Divorce Club London can help.

We know it can be really tough going through a divorce. Itâ€™s hard to find people who know how you feel unless theyâ€™ve been through it. Divorce Club London is hosted by people who have been through a divorce and who know exactly what youâ€™re going through (whatsmore our co-founder Isabelle is a clinical psychologist). So we know that the best remedy for the pain of divorce is to meet others in the same boat and make a fresh start. We also know that trying to navigate the legal and financial side is an additional pressure, just when youâ€™re at your lowest ebb.

Divorce Club London connects people to every single resource they may need to get through a divorce from the moment of separation to moving on and meeting someone new. We aim to reduce the sense of isolation and overwhelm in the first stage of separation but also look to help people identify how to look forward and rebuild their lives. We fundamentally believe out of the ashes of the end of a relationship, new beginnings and a huge opportunity for growth arise.

For newly separated people we offer advice and help on the process and emotional overwhelm. As people go through the process they have continuous access to legal and financial advice while also being able to tap into a community of people who can share the roller coaster of milestones, difficulties and triumphs. And for those in the later stages we offer coaching for goal setting, and online sessions for moving on, dating and growth.

Divorce Club London provides expert information that takes the mystery and fear out of divorce. We have guest speakers from top law firms, mediators, psychologists, parenting experts, divorce coaches, financial advisors, dating experts and many more - advice that usually costs a lot of money!

For less than the price of a weekly takeout coffee, you can join us and meet other people who know exactly what youâ€™re going through.

Membership includes access to:

* Weekly social zoom calls
* Legal Q&As with respected family lawyers
* Financial Q&As
* Parenting sessions
* Goal setting
* Book clubs
* Divorce orientated workshops
* Access to a 24/7 community messaging channel
* In real life meetups and socials

For just Â£7.99 a month, you can get inclusive access to all of our events, access to chat in our private community, and a service which aims to match you with friends. We even give you the first month for free.
Whatsmore, we host a free Meetup group session once a month so you can come and see what Divorce Club is all about.

So we hope that you invest in giving yourself a better divorce, and a better recovery. We passionately believe that you can have an amazing life after divorce! There is such an opportunity for growth and many of our members have said how much happier they are two, three, four years down the line â€“ so hang on in there. Start again, with us.

We look forward to meeting you!
Lucy Davis & Dr Isabelle Hung

**[SIGN UP TO BE A MEMBER â€“ FIRST MONTH FREE!](https://www.divorceclub.com/membership/)**

**\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-**

**Join Divorce Club**
**Find out more at [Divorce Club](https://www.divorceclub.com/), and see our [membership options](https://www.divorceclub.com/membership/)**

name: Hampshire Social Events-Surrey
description:
Hello \

\

Thanks for showing your interest in this group. \

\

This meetup group is ideal for single people and couples who would like to socialise and build up friendships. This group would suit anybody over 35 as long as your heart is young and your mind is open for adventure. \

\

Events like beach and barbeque parties, walking, ten pin bowling, weekend trips will be offered and any other suggestions from our members will be considered during the year. \

\

\-\-\-\-\-Fees\-\-\-\- \

\

To cover any costs from e.g. obtaining documents for event planning, paying meetup fee, etc., Most of the events will have a fee of Â£3.

\

If you would like to host any event then you are welcome to discuss this with me. \

\

\-\-\-\-General Rules\-\-\-\- \

\

To join us, your meetup profile should have a clear photo showing your face and should not be older than 5 years. Your profile also needs to show your real name. Without those two criterion, your request of membership will not be accepted or even deleted. \

\

We reserve the right to delete your membership if your behaviour is inappropriate like rude, aggressive, confrontational and so on. At our age, we should already know how to treat people appropriately. Furthermore, we also reserve the right to remove a member who does not fit in the group whatever the reason is. \

In the case you register for an event and later realise that you cannot join the event, then please change your attending status as there is usually a wait list and it is only fair to others. Failure to do this resulting in two 'no shows' will mean that you will be removed from the group. \

\-\-\-\-Legal Disclaimer\-\-\-\-
By signing up for this group or any of the events, you agree that you have read and understand the below.
Additionally, by signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. The Group Organiser, Event Host or any other person is not responsible for your safety. Please ensure that you are fit enough to attend walks and bring sufficient water and food with you. For participating in other types of events (e.g. swimming, camping, bowling), you take part AT YOUR OWN RISK and are responsible for your own safety and well-being.
If you join us for any events or holiday, please understand that you are also responsible for your own preparation. You are responsible for making your own travel arrangements and any necessary travel insurance.
Participants are responsible for assessing their own risk, the safety of themselves and their guests and the suitability of any equipment used.
You have voluntarily elected to participate in the events and FULLY ACCEPT AND ASSUME ALL RISKS AND ALL RESPONSIBILITY FOR ANY INJURY, LOSSES AND DAMAGES TO PERSON OR PROPERTY THAT INCUR AS A RESULT OF YOUR PARTICIPATION.
We are not trained leaders, guides or first aiders and we do not employ qualified guides, leaders or first aiders at any events. There may not be rescue or medical facilities or expertise necessary in the immediate area to deal with the Risks to which you may be exposed during our activities.
The Organizerâ€™s role is to coordinate the gathering of people at the appointed meeting place for the group to voluntarily take part in the organized Event. It is the same basis of being a group of friends or voluntaries who are undertaking activities (indoor or outdoor) together who invites others to join any activities on this basis via the Meetup web site.
Remember: YOU ARE ATTENDING ALL EVENTS AT YOUR OWN RISK.!
PHOTOGRAPHY
This group may, from time to time, take photographic, digital or video images of event participants for promoting the group. You hereby agree to allow this group to use those images for that purpose without expectation of privacy or renumeration.
PLEASE DO NOT PARTICIPATE IN ANY ORGANIZED EVENTS UNLESS YOU HAVE READ, UNDERSTOOD AND AGREED ITS ENTIRETY.
We are looking forward to meeting you.

Note: We might delete your membership if we believe that you were not more active between 6 months and 2 years. However, you are welcome to join us again when you believe that you would be more active in this group. However, an re-joining fee of Â£5 will be asked.

name: Female Friends - London (20-45yrs)
description:
Welcome to our community! This group is made for ladies who want to make new female friends in London in a relaxed environment. We hope you will make lifelong girlfriends here, as well as enjoy all the fun London has to offer. There will be several events each month ranging from brunch, theatre, days out and much more! Suggestions for events are welcomed and encouraged. We encourage new people to attend, so feel free to RSVP to events that take you interest! ğŸ‘©ğŸ¿â€ğŸ¤â€ğŸ‘©ğŸ¼â¤ï¸

<br>


Our Ethos -

We want everyone to contribute to the success and joy of this group, and this involves turning up to the events you RSVP to. Showing up is a commitment we want everyone to make, as this helps the organisers maximise the spaces booked, helps the attendees meet more new people, and most importantly it help you fulfil the commitment you made to yourself to meet nice new friends.


WE STRICTLY DO NOT DO ANY NETWORING OR ANY BUSINESS-RELATED EVENTS OF ANY KIND, NO EXCEPTIONS. This group is for meaningful friendships and quality time amongst women in London.


NO-SHOW POLICY â€“ We would like to maximise every event for your full enjoyment, therefore we encourage you to turn up to the events you RSVP to. All attendance is monitored. TWO missed events will be marked as 'no-shows', and a polite reminder will be sent to you. If you do not show up THREE times when you have RSVP'd as "Yes" without sending a message and changing your RSVP, you will be automatically removed from the group. Its important you RSVP to things you can attend to, and change you RSVP in good time if other plans come up. Please do this so we can offer your spot to someone else if you decide not to attend. This rule applies to last minute drop outs (UNDER 48hrs) without a message too. This is to make sure that we maximise all the space we book for events and include more people who want to participate and enjoy meeting each other.

<br>

PAYMENT - Please note, running this group is not free and lead organisers pay Meet-up a monthly fee to keep the group running. Therefore RSVPs will be charged a non-refundable Â£3 for all events. Some events might also require an additional fee if the restaurant or event venue requires a prepayment. This Â£3 is non-refundable under all circumstances unless only if the organisers cancel the event. If you cancel your RSVP the non-refund still applies. If you would like to support the continued running of this group you can also donate any amount to our PayPal pool which I can send to you if you request the link :)

<br>

WAITLIST - Please be aware that we currently don't have waitlist and all events are first come first serve. Updates will be sent out once we can have a functioning waitlist.

<br>

SAFETY AND COURTESY: We want everyone to have a fun and safe time when attending our events, and we want our organisers to communicate with attendees about event updates with confidence that they will be treated with respect - therefore we follow Meet-up's policy on safety strictly. We do not tolerate any abusive language towards anyone in this group. Please DM people with respect. Any members found to be harassing/insulting/threatening/bullying any member of this group will be removed immediately and the ban will be permanent. We also make reports to meet-up who have the power to remove any policy breakers of the platform completely.


SOCIAL MEDIA: Our Instagram handle is @femalefriendsLDN. Please follow. We take pictures at events. If you do not want your picture uploaded please let the organiser know and they will delete all pictures featuring you.

name: Bermondsey Boulders
description:
Ever wanted to try bouldering/indoor wall climbing? It is an exciting and fun way to stay fit: it is challenging, both physically and mentally, and a great way to exercise! I remember walking pass the Arch at Bermondsey and wondering â€œwhere on earth are those people walking to, especially with those funny shoes hanging from their backpacksâ€ before I knew it I was one of those people! lol

I plan to have weekly bouldering Meet-ups for people who are curious about bouldering or like bouldering and want to have some good company and vibes while at it. We can cheer each other on and work on problems together!

All levels are welcome! Even if you are a complete beginner, though kindly please watch the safety intro video ([The Arch Climbing Wall - Safety Intro ](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vBTStDqP_9c)) and fill out the [register online form here ](https://signups.archclimbingwall.com/)\- please make sure to watch the video all the way through as there is important info in it that youâ€™ll be asked a few questions about on your very first visit to the Arch centre\. Nevertheless\, you will have your fellow Bermondsey Boulders to support you on your very first climb and future climbs :\-\)

I am sure the intermediate and advance climbers will be happy to share some tips when you attend, I know I will need it lol. Letâ€™s get to know each other and help each other out to make this group a positive and fulfilling experience for everyone.

Twice a week, from 6:30pm on Wednesday and 11:00am on Sundays we will be meeting at the Surrey Quays Arch & Bermondsey Arch. Let us enjoy bouldering together. The entrance is within the biscuit factory compound that also has the PureGym Bermondsey branch. For the Surrey Quays centre, you can't miss it just go to the Shopping centre entrance and it will be on your left.

All you need to bring are a comfortable change of clothes that are easy to move in. The Arch provides lockers to keep your personal belongings safe as well.

The Surrey Quays branch is now completed this new Rotherhithe SE16 branch is located in the heart of the biggest Shopping Complex in the Borough, so cool right? And do not worry, it is literally the same distance you will travel from Bermondsey Station to Arch one. 

After the Sunday session, let us have lunch together at the famous Bermondsey Maltby Street Market..it is a 15 minute walk from the Arch.â€¦. They have a good variety of cooked food to buy.. yum!

This event is completely free to attend, and the only costs you have to bear are the Arch fees and/or shoe rental.

Indoor bouldering is safe (if you follow the guidelines) and offers a great workout, no matter what your age! So if you have ever been curious about the sport of bouldering, or wanting to get back into it with some company this group is a great place to start in what I hope will be a safe and friendly atmosphere for you. Check out some of our session's highlights here - https://www.meetup.com/bermondsey-boulders/photos/

The bouldering sessions will be taking place in the Arch centres (bouldering only) in SE16. These are located in theÂ neighbouring districts of Bermondsey and Rotherhithe (Southwark is so bless)

If you have any questions, feel free to DM me! Letâ€™s enjoy bouldering together and make new friends along the way !

[Event Summary]

Locations: Arch Climbing Wall: Building One, Bermondsey SE16 (10min from Bermondsey Station)
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Arch Climbing Wall, Surrey Quays, Rotherhithe SE16 (10min from Canada Water Station & Surrey Quays Overground Station)

Date & Time: Twice a week,
6:30pm - 9:30pm (Can join and leave anytime, Wednesdays)
Â Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  11:00am - 13:00pm (Lunch afterwards at Maltby Street Market, Sundays)

Level: Beginners are welcome! (Experienced climbers can share tips)

Event Fee: Free (You only pay for the Arch entrance fee)

Equipment: Nothing (you can rent shoes and chalk at the gym or buy your own)

Extra: Students and certain key workers can bring their ID for discount !

\*\*\*\*\*\*
Bouldering meetup is for 18 years and above.

Pictures may be taken on the days for the group page.

Three unexplained no-shows will be removed from group

Please provide an actual photo of yourself and at least your first name
